You wake up from a coma to find that all life on Earth will be wiped out in 48 hrs, which Apocalypse scenario would you choose and why ?

1> Zombies, the brain eating kind (slow moving) 2> Robot uprising 3> BIG Asteroid 4> Other.
Cause big robots.

Godzilla's cooler.

Plus, you can bring the big robots in to fight him. Two birds with one stone.
This is about which is the cooler way? Then asteroid. There is something poetic in it, like an ancient Greek tragedy.

This is about which is the cooler way? Then asteroid. There is something poetic in it, like an ancient Greek tragedy.

Too fast though. If we're all going to die, I at least want the show to last more than ten minutes.
I'd say an asteroid. I would grab my car and drive 800 km to the southeast where the Alps are and hide in one of the deep valleys. Probably a futile attempt if the asteroid wipes all life out though.

Too fast though. If we're all going to die, I at least want the show to last more than ten minutes.

Fast? The initial mayhem would last for an hour!

I'd say an asteroid. I would grab my car and drive 800 km to the southeast where the Alps are and hide in one of the deep valleys. Probably a futile attempt if the asteroid wipes all life out though.

You might do alright for a while, until the sun disappears. You pretty much have two choices. Fire or ice.

Fast? The initial mayhem would last for an hour!

With a shockwave travelling at 500mph? You wouldn't get to see much before you were smashed.

Edited April 26, 2014 by vger

Infertility.

At least the last humans can still live for a while and the end is generally painless.

Infertility. At least the last humans can still live for a while and the end is generally painless.

If infertility starts showing signs of being an issue, I'm buying stock in cloning

But it would certainly make a particular aspect of recreation more worry-free.

With a shockwave travelling at 500mph? You wouldn't get to see much before you were smashed.

Let's suppose I'm far enough to just see it start grazing the atmosphere at the horizon (otherwise it would fry me with thermal rays) and then it hits other side of the continent, so I get to see fireworks. It all depends what it hits, at what angle and where you are relative to it.

Infertility.

At least the last humans can still live for a while and the end is generally painless.

Interesting. I wonder if we'd kill ourselves by STDs before we all die of old age.
Zombies are so old fashioned, can it be a necromorph outbreak?

I would prefer to choose zombies. The brain eating, easy to topple over and destroy with shovels, rising from graves, non-infectious, weaker & slower than grandma kind.

Because it wouldn't really be an apocalypse when you topple over and destroy all the zombies, and you wouldn't really panic when you have medicine to fight regular infections that attack through zombie bites (Not zombie infections, mind you)
Asteroid impact near a supervolcano. Would be a sight to see.

Robot uprising. Because according to XKCD with our current technology the most damage they can do would be a predator drone blowing up stuff in some middle eastern country and then crashing because it ran out of fuel. Fighting bots would be hilarious because they would be defeated with a bucket of water.

Asteroid impact near a supervolcano. Would be a sight to see.

Only if you're in orbit. Otherwise, you'd never get the chance to see anything because you'd be dead (or burning alive) before the thing impacts.

Only if you're in orbit. Otherwise, you'd never get the chance to see anything because you'd be dead (or burning alive) before the thing impacts.

That depends on how far away you are. A small asteroid hitting a supervolcano would probably be enough to cause some pretty fireworks without incinerating everyone in line-of-sight around the Earth...for a few minutes anyway.

Why not just have an asteroid full of robots impact the planet. Those robots have radioactive weaponry which turns anyone nearby into zombies.

Add a volcano for good measure.

Mass destruction, robots, zombies. If there's going to be an apocalypse it should at least be a good one

That depends on how far away you are. A small asteroid hitting a supervolcano would probably be enough to cause some pretty fireworks without incinerating everyone in line-of-sight around the Earth...for a few minutes anyway.

If you're not near its path, and the supervolcano is on the horizon, you'd see a bright globe of light before you die from the shockwave. Any more closer, on in the path of the asteroid, and you'd be toasted, literally.

Why not just have an asteroid full of robots impact the planet. Those robots have radioactive weaponry which turns anyone nearby into zombies.

Add a volcano for good measure.

Mass destruction, robots, zombies. If there's going to be an apocalypse it should at least be a good one

Shut up and take my money!

You wake up from a coma to find that all life on Earth will be wiped out in 48 hrs, which Apocalypse scenario would you choose and why ?

1> Zombies, the brain eating kind (slow moving) 2> Robot uprising 3> BIG Asteroid 4> Other.

I'm assuming that I've been comatose on Earth. Since all life on Earth will be wiped out in 2 days, this makes for a very short apocalypse; with no life surviving. I choose Other; that Hawaiian vacation.
Robot uprising, because of this.
What about a movie-style alien invasion? Fireworks, chance of survival, and you might even fight them off!

What about a movie-style alien invasion? Fireworks, chance of survival, and you might even fight them off!

If there was a chance at surviving a while, even if death was inevitable, I'd like a scenario that allowed me to see how many of the mofos I could take down with me.

Probably a vacuum metastability event. It's painless and instant, and there's no being sad for other dead people. You're all dead at practically the same time.

Edited April 27, 2014 by TheDarkStar

Probably a vacuum metastability event. It's painless and instant, and there's no being sad for other dead people. You're all dead at practically the same time.

It's too instant. You wouldn't be able to know it's coming, and impossibility of detection due to lightspeed would probably disqualify it from "wake up from a coma and discover apocalypse in 48 hrs"
I vote Godzilla with the giant robots... always the chance of sequel = BIGGER robot/s
